column4: Does anyone know how to read strace? -- all the apt-* utilities are choking on the newly downloaded package lists -- I delted them, did apt-get update and they choke: heres a strace of apt-cache search test: http://www.cc.gatech.edu/~achille/apt-cache-strace.txt
is that strace output with the "follow forks" option enabled?
i simply did `strace apt-cache search test &> output.txt`
use the -FF option (I believe) in the strace call to follow execution into forks
actually, it may just be -f
(I had to boot back into Windows, so I can't check at my prompt)
it's -F, hold on while I upload it
http://www.cc.gatech.edu/~achille/strace2.txt
ugh -- not much more help there.
have you looked at "var/lib/apt/lists/archive.ubuntu.com_ubuntu_dists_edgy_main_binary-i386_Packages" ?
are any filesystem errors reported in 'dmesg'?
I deleted that file, apt-get update re downloads it and then it chokes on it again
nothing serious on dmesg
I dunno.  I mean, if you've run 'apt-get clean' and you're still getting the crash then I suggest that you escalate it to a developer in #ubuntu-devel
simply put, it's a SIGSEGV...which could be due to file/data corruption, disk errors, mismatching libraries (doubtful), etc...
have you tried using a different sources.list?  Maybe the downloaded file itself is corrupt and when it's parsed it causes an error.
how would I run a fsck? it tells me it's dangerous to do it on a mounted volume -- should I ignore that error ?
no, don't ignore it.
!fsck | minerale
I'll try that, thanks
odds are that you don't have filesystem corruption.  I suggest that you start by changing your sources.list file to download everything from a different server, run "apt-get clean", and try again.
